entries.meaning: (sciences) A small tube, often with an enlargement or bulb in the middle, and usually graduated, used for transferring or delivering measured quantities of a liquid. [from 19th c.]

verbs.description: pipette (third-person singular simple present pipettes, present participle pipetting, simple past and past participle pipetted)

entries.meaning: To transfer or measure the volume of a liquid using a pipette.
